column1: #Text=North Korea puts military in ' quasi-state of war '

#Text=According to Yonhap news agency , quoting North Korea 's main news agency Korean Central News Agency ( KCNA ) , the country 's military has been placed on high alert and has been told to prepare a " quasi-state of war " .
#Text=The report comes after North and South Korea exchanged artillery fire yesterday .
#Text=" War maniacs of the South Korean puppet military made another grave provocation to the DPRK in the central western sector of the front on Thursday afternoon .

column1: #Text=Yesterday , North Korea fired artillery rounds aimed at a loudspeaker in South Korea that broadcasts anti-Pyongyang propaganda into the North .

#Text=" Commanders of the Korean People 's Army were hastily dispatched to the front-line troops to command military operations to destroy psychological warfare tools if the enemy does not stop the propaganda broadcast within 48 hours and prepare against the enemy 's possible counteractions " , added KCNA .
#Text=No injuries or deaths were reported in the attacks from either side , but South Korea evacuated about 80 people in the town of Yeoncheon after at least one shell landed near the area .
#Text=The South retaliated by firing dozens of rounds of artillery into the north .
#Text=South Korea had recently started to broadcast propaganda from loudspeakers after an 11-year lull .
#Text=The broadcasts began on August 10 and South Korea says the broadcasts will continue .
#Text=After the exchange of fire , North Korea stated it would attack any loudspeakers broadcasting propaganda and would respond , militarily , within 48 hours if the broadcasts do not stop .
#Text=Both countries have put their militaries on high levels of alert .
